actions.text: Referred to House Committee on House Administration.

official_title: A bill to provide for the regulation of the process by which the people of the United States nominate candidates for President and Vice President.

summary.text: National Primary Act - Provides for the nomination of party Presidential and Vice Presidential candidates by popular vote in a national closed primary election. Sets forth guidelines for such elections including those relative to (1) eligibility for placement of parties and candidates on ballots, (2) eligibility to vote, and (3) in the event no candidate receives a majority of the votes cast by party members runoff elections.

titles.title: A bill to provide for the regulation of the process by which the people of the United States nominate candidates for President and Vice President.
